column4: Ecuadorian bank sues Wells Fargo over hacker thefts
column5: Wells Fargo Bank failed to follow its own fraud detection policies  honoring millions of dollars of fraudulent international transactions that should have triggered alerts  a lawsuit by an Ecuadorian bank alleges.

column4: Wells Fargo  BofA look to integrate Apple Pay into ATMs: TechCrunch
column5: Wells Fargo & Co and Bank of America Corp are working to integrate mobile payment system Apple Pay into their ATMs  technology news website TechCrunch reported.

column4: UPDATE 1-Wells Fargo  BofA look to integrate Apple Pay into ATMs -TechCrunch
column5: Jan 28 Wells Fargo & Co and Bank of America Corp are working to integrate mobile payment system Apple Pay into their ATMs  technology news website TechCrunch reported.

column4: Axiall rejects $1.4 billion offer from Westlake Chemical
column5: Axiall Corp   a U.S. chemical and building products maker  said on Friday it had rejected Westlake Chemical Corp's  $1.4 billion cash-and-stock offer  dismissing it as an attempt to scoop up its vinyls assets on the cheap.

column4: Deals of the day- Mergers and acquisitions
column5: Jan 29 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2100 GMT on Friday:

column4: Westlake Chemical says Axiall rejects $1.4 bln offer
column5: Jan 29 Westlake Chemical Corp said chemical and building products maker Axiall Corp had rejected its $1.4 billion cash-and-stock offer.

column4: Whirlpool sees North America driving growth in 2016
column5: Whirlpool Corp  reported a better-than-expected quarterly profit and said consumer demand is likely to remain resilient in North America  its biggest market  this year.

column4: UPDATE 3-Whirlpool sees North America driving growth in 2016
column5: * Shares rise as much as 5.3 pct   (Adds details from conference call  shares)

column4: Whirlpool quarterly profit more than doubles
column5: Jan 29 Whirlpool Corp said its quarterly profit more than doubled  helped by cost- and capacity-reduction actions and acquisitions.

column4: Xerox to split into two companies  Icahn to get board seats on one
column5: Xerox Corp  will split into two companies  one holding its legacy printer operations and the other its business process outsourcing unit  it said on Friday  in a bid to be more nimble after years of trying to integrate the businesses. |Â Video

column4: UPDATE 3-Xerox to split into two companies  Icahn to get board seats on one
column5: Jan 29 Xerox Corp will split into two companies  one holding its legacy printer operations and the other its business process outsourcing unit  it said on Friday  in a bid to be more nimble after years of trying to integrate the businesses.

column4: Printer maker Xerox to split into two
column5: Jan 29 Xerox Corp said it would split into two companies  one holding its legacy hardware operations and the other its business process outsourcing unit.

column4: Xerox to split in two; give Icahn three board seats: WSJ
column5: Xerox Corp will split into two companies and give activist investor Carl Icahn three seats on the board of one of the companies  the Wall Street Journal reported.
